text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
author: Buddha

text: Your time is limited, don't waste it living someone else's life.
author: Steve Jobs

text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

text: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

text: Get busy living or get busy dying.
author: Stephen King

text: Whether you think you can or you think you can't, you're right.
author: Henry Ford

text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Dream big and dare to fail.
author: Norman Vaughan

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: Everything you can imagine is real.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: What we think, we become.
author: Buddha

text: Happiness is not something readymade. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama

text: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

text: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Do one thing every day that scares you.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

text: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
author: Confucius

text: Build your own dreams, or someone else will hire you to build theirs.
author: Farraj Gray

text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson

text: Keep your face always toward the sunshine—and shadows will fall behind you.
author: Walt Whitman

text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The best revenge is massive success.
author: Frank Sinatra

text: Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
author: John D. Rockefeller

text: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
author: Jimmy Dean

text: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else.
author: Booker T. Washington

text: Limitations live only in our minds. But if we use our imaginations, our possibilities become limitless.
author: Jamie Paolinetti

text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking.
author: William Butler Yeats

text: It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me.
author: Ayn Rand

text: A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
author: Arthur Ashe

text: Too many of us are not living our dreams because we are living our fears.
author: Les Brown

text: Challenges are what make life interesting and overcoming them is what makes life meaningful.
author: Joshua J. Marine

text: If you are not willing to risk the usual, you will have to settle for the ordinary.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says 'I'm possible'!
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: The difference between ordinary and extraordinary is that little extra.
author: Jimmy Johnson

text: We know what we are, but know not what we may be.
author: William Shakespeare

text: The harder the conflict, the more glorious the triumph.
author: Thomas Paine

text: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: The mind is not a vessel to be filled, but a fire to be kindled.
author: Plutarch

text: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams! Live the life you've imagined.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Life is 10% what happens to us and 90% how we react to it.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

text: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.
author: Mark Twain

text: When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot in it and hang on.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: There is no substitute for hard work.
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: Whatever the mind of man can conceive and believe, it can achieve.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Strive for progress, not perfection.
author: unknown

text: You take your life in your own hands, and what happens? A terrible thing, no one to blame.
author: Erica Jong

text: What's money? A man is a success if he gets up in the morning and goes to bed at night and in between does what he wants to do.
author: Bob Dylan

text: In order to succeed, we must first believe that we can.
author: Nikos Kazantzakis

text: If you want to make your dreams come true, the first thing you have to do is wake up.
author: J.M. Power

text: Let us make our future now, and let us make our dreams tomorrow's reality.
author: Malala Yousafzai

text: The only source of knowledge is experience.
author: Albert Einstein

text: All our dreams can come true if we have the courage to pursue them.
author: Walt Disney

text: It always seems impossible until it's done.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising up every time we fall.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Don't let yesterday take up too much of today.
author: Will Rogers

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: Good, better, best. Never let it rest. 'Til your good is better and your better is best.
author: St. Jerome

text: You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do.
author: Henry Ford

text: Without hustle, talent will only carry you so far.
author: Gary Vaynerchuk

text: To accomplish great things, we must not only act, but also dream; not only plan, but also believe.
author: Anatole France

text: We become what we think about most of the time, and that's the strangest secret.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: A goal is a dream with a deadline.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: If you're going through hell, keep going.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Opportunity does not knock, it presents itself when you beat down the door.
author: Kyle Chandler

text: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

text: I find that the harder I work, the more luck I seem to have.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: It's not whether you get knocked down, it's whether you get up.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: Work hard in silence, let your success be your noise.
author: Frank Ocean

text: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: Believe in yourself and all that you are. Know that there is something inside you that is greater than any obstacle.
author: Christian D. Larson

text: The only thing standing between you and your goal is the story you keep telling yourself as to why you can't achieve it.
author: Jordan Belfort

text: Your positive action combined with positive thinking results in success.
author: Shiv Khera

text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: If you can dream it, you can achieve it.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Great minds discuss ideas; average minds discuss events; small minds discuss people.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Winning isn't everything, but wanting to win is.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: An unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

text: Eighty percent of success is showing up.
author: Woody Allen

text: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Don't let someone else's opinion of you become your reality.
author: Les Brown

text: If you want to live a happy life, tie it to a goal, not to people or things.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Just one small positive thought in the morning can change your whole day.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Opportunities don't happen, you create them.
author: Chris Grosser

text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama

text: For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
author: Aristotle

text: The most important thing is to enjoy your life—to be happy—it's all that matters.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.
author: William Shakespeare

text: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
author: David Viscott

text: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
author: Aristotle

text: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Where there is love there is life.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
author: John D. Rockefeller

text: Success is not in what you have, but who you are.
author: Bo Bennett

text: The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same.
author: Colin R. Davis

text: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Friendship is born at that moment when one person says to another, 'What! You too? I thought I was the only one.'
author: C.S. Lewis

text: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.
author: Walter Winchell

text: True friendship comes when the silence between two people is comfortable.
author: David Tyson

text: There is nothing on this earth more to be prized than true friendship.
author: Thomas Aquinas

text: A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: It is health that is real wealth and not pieces of gold and silver.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The greatest wealth is health.
author: Virgil

text: Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.
author: Jim Rohn

text: A healthy outside starts from the inside.
author: Robert Urich

text: To keep the body in good health is a duty… otherwise we shall not be able to keep our mind strong and clear.
author: Buddha

text: Fitness is not about being better than someone else. It's about being better than you used to be.
author: Khloe Kardashian

text: Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.
author: Jim Rohn

text: The only bad workout is the one that didn't happen.
author: Unknown

text: Strength does not come from the physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: You don't have to be extreme, just consistent.
author: Unknown

text: Mindfulness is the key to a happy and balanced life.
author: Unknown

text: Feelings come and go like clouds in a windy sky. Conscious breathing is my anchor.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

text: Do every act of your life as though it were the very last act of your life.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The present moment is filled with joy and happiness. If you are attentive, you will see it.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

text: Mindfulness isn't difficult, we just need to remember to do it.
author: Sharon Salzberg

text: Productivity is never an accident. It is always the result of a commitment to excellence, intelligent planning, and focused effort.
author: Paul J. Meyer

text: It's not always that we need to do more but rather that we need to focus on less.
author: Nathan W. Morris

text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

text: You may delay, but time will not.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Simplicity boils down to two steps: Identify the essential. Eliminate the rest.
author: Leo Babauta

text: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
author: Confucius

text: Opportunities don't happen. You create them.
author: Chris Grosser

text: Dreams are extremely important. You can't do it unless you imagine it.
author: George Lucas

text: Work to become, not to acquire.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work.
author: Steve Jobs

text: A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way.
author: John C. Maxwell

text: Leadership is not about titles, positions, or flowcharts. It is about one life influencing another.
author: John C. Maxwell

text: Before you are a leader, success is all about growing yourself. When you become a leader, success is all about growing others.
author: Jack Welch

text: The greatest leader is not necessarily the one who does the greatest things. He is the one that gets the people to do the greatest things.
author: Ronald Reagan

text: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Family is not an important thing. It's everything.
author: Michael J. Fox

text: The love in our family flows strong and deep, leaving us memories to treasure and keep.
author: Unknown

text: In time of test, family is best.
author: Burmese Proverb

text: The family is one of nature's masterpieces.
author: George Santayana

text: Rejoice with your family in the beautiful land of life.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Assumptions are the termites of relationships.
author: Henry Winkler

text: A great relationship is about two things: first, appreciating the similarities, and second, respecting the differences.
author: Unknown

text: We are most alive when we're in love.
author: John Updike

text: Ultimately the bond of all companionship, whether in marriage or in friendship, is conversation.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
author: Aesop

text: Kindness is the language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
author: Mark Twain

text: You can always give something, even if it is only kindness.
author: Anne Frank

text: Carry out a random act of kindness, with no expectation of reward.
author: Princess Diana

text: A single act of kindness throws out roots in all directions.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: What you do today can improve all your tomorrows.
author: Ralph Marston

text: Be not afraid of growing slowly, be afraid only of standing still.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Improvement begins with I.
author: Arnold H. Glasow

text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Gratitude turns what we have into enough.
author: Aesop

text: When I started counting my blessings, my whole life turned around.
author: Willie Nelson

text: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others.
author: Cicero

text: Enjoy the little things, for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things.
author: Robert Brault

text: Silent gratitude isn't much use to anyone.
author: G.B. Stern

text: Do not judge me by my success, judge me by how many times I fell down and got back up again.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Resilience is knowing that you are the only one that has the power and the responsibility to pick yourself up.
author: Mary Holloway

text: Life doesn't get easier or more forgiving, we get stronger and more resilient.
author: Steve Maraboli

text: Out of difficulties grow miracles.
author: Jean de La Bruyère

text: You do not have a soul. You are a soul. You have a body.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: The spiritual journey is the unlearning of fear and the acceptance of love.
author: Marianne Williamson

text: Your sacred space is where you can find yourself again and again.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: Awakening is not changing who you are, but discarding who you are not.
author: Deepak Chopra

text: It is in the stillness that the voice of the spirit speaks.
author: Unknown

text: Peace begins with a smile.
author: Mother Teresa

text: Nothing can bring you peace but yourself.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: When the power of love overcomes the love of power, the world will know peace.
author: Jimi Hendrix

text: Peace is not absence of conflict, it is the ability to handle conflict by peaceful means.
author: Ronald Reagan

text: Do not let the behavior of others destroy your inner peace.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Meditation is the tongue of the soul and the language of our spirit.
author: Jeremy Taylor

text: The thing about meditation is: You become more and more you.
author: David Lynch

text: Meditation is a way for nourishing and blossoming the divinity within you.
author: Amit Ray

text: Through meditation, the higher self is attained.
author: Sivananda Saraswati

text: The goal of meditation isn't to control your thoughts; it's to stop letting them control you.
author: Unknown

text: Laughter is the best medicine.
author: Unknown

text: A day without laughter is a day wasted.
author: Charlie Chaplin

text: Humor is mankind's greatest blessing.
author: Mark Twain

text: A good laugh is sunshine in the house.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

text: If you're not having fun, you're doing it wrong.
author: Mario Andretti

text: Life is too important to be taken seriously.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Do more of what makes you happy.
author: Unknown

text: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: It's not whether you win or lose, it's how you play the game.
author: Unknown

text: The secret to having fun is doing what you love.
author: Unknown

text: The purpose of entertainment is not to show us something new, but to help us see something in a new way.
author: Unknown

text: Entertainment is the most important thing in the world to some people.
author: Unknown

text: The best entertainment is not something that gives you a new perspective, but something that makes you forget your perspective.
author: Unknown

text: Entertainment is the ability to take people's minds off their problems for a little while.
author: Unknown

text: The best kind of entertainment is the kind that makes you laugh and makes you think.
author: Unknown

text: If you don't like the road you're walking, start paving another one.
author: Dolly Parton

text: The biggest adventure you can ever take is to live the life of your dreams.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: I'd rather regret the things I've done than regret the things I haven't done.
author: Lucille Ball

text: Don't wait for opportunity, create it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Ambition is the path to success. Persistence is the vehicle you arrive in.
author: Bill Bradley

text: Most folks are about as happy as they make up their minds to be.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: If I loved you less, I might be able to talk about it more.
author: Jane Austen

text: Friendship is the only cement that will ever hold the world together.
author: Woodrow Wilson

text: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
author: Anais Nin

text: We must be willing to get rid of the life we've planned, so as to have the life that is waiting for us.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: You cannot change what you refuse to confront.
author: Unknown

text: Sometimes good things fall apart so better things can fall together.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: The world hates change, yet it is the only thing that has brought progress.
author: Charles Kettering

text: Intelligence is the ability to adapt to change.
author: Stephen Hawking

text: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Learning never exhausts the mind.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Your most unhappy customers are your greatest source of learning.
author: Bill Gates

text: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The smallest act of kindness is worth more than the grandest intention.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog, it's too dark to read.
author: Groucho Marx

text: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
author: Alan Kay

text: The only thing you sometimes have control over is perspective. You don't have control over your situation. But you have a choice about how you view it.
author: Chris Pine

text: The earth has music for those who listen.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: A professional writer is an amateur who didn't quit.
author: Richard Bach

text: That's the thing about books. They let you travel without moving your feet.
author: Jhumpa Lahiri

text: My barn having burned down, I can now see the moon.
author: Mizuta Masahide

text: Life is a journey, and if you fall in love with the journey, you will be in love forever.
author: Peter Hagerty

text: There's a world of difference between truth and facts. Facts can obscure the truth.
author: Maya Angelou

text: The obscure we see eventually. The completely obvious, it seems, takes longer.
author: Edward R. Murrow

text: A great deal of talent is lost to the world for want of a little courage.
author: Sydney Smith

text: That men do not learn very much from the lessons of history is the most important of all the lessons that history has to teach.
author: Aldous Huxley

text: A great civilization is not conquered from without until it has destroyed itself from within.
author: Will Durant

text: Sometimes life drops blessings in your lap without your lifting a finger. Serendipity, they call it.
author: Charlton Heston

text: Innovation is serendipity, so you don't know what people will make.
author: Tim Berners-Lee

text: What people call serendipity sometimes is just having your eyes open.
author: Jose Manuel Barroso

text: Things don't turn up in this world until somebody turns them up.
author: James A. Garfield

text: The most basic and powerful way to connect to another person is to listen.
author: Rachel Naomi Remen

text: We cannot live for ourselves alone. Our lives are connected by a thousand invisible threads.
author: Herman Melville

text: Exploration is really the essence of the human spirit.
author: Frank Borman

text: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.
author: Marcel Proust

text: Without craftsmanship, inspiration is a mere reed shaken in the wind.
author: Johannes Brahms

text: Silence is a true friend who never betrays.
author: Confucius

text: The quieter you become, the more you can hear.
author: Ram Dass

text: For my part I know nothing with any certainty, but the sight of the stars makes me dream.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

text: The monotony and solitude of a quiet life stimulates the creative mind.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The real problem is not whether machines think but whether men do.
author: B.F. Skinner

text: One is never afraid of the unknown; one is afraid of the known coming to an end.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

text: Humility is not thinking less of yourself, it's thinking of yourself less.
author: Rick Warren

text: Follow effective action with quiet reflection. From the quiet reflection will come even more effective action.
author: Peter F. Drucker

text: We are not human beings having a spiritual experience. We are spiritual beings having a human experience.
author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

text: Loving yourself isn't vanity; it's sanity.
author: Katrina Mayer

text: The path isn't a straight line; it's a spiral. You continually come back to things you thought you understood and see deeper truths.
author: Barry Gillespie

text: Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: There is a kind of beauty in imperfection.
author: Conrad Hall

text: Time moves in one direction, memory in another.
author: William Gibson

text: Without memory, there is no culture. Without memory, there would be no civilization, no society, no future.
author: Elie Wiesel

text: When the whole world is silent, even one voice becomes powerful.
author: Malala Yousafzai

text: It took me quite a long time to develop a voice, and now that I have it, I am not going to be silent.
author: Madeleine Albright

text: Feet, what do I need you for when I have wings to fly?
author: Frida Kahlo

text: Carve your name on hearts, not tombstones. A legacy is etched into the minds of others and the stories they share about you.
author: Shannon Alder

text: Dig the well before you are thirsty.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: A bit of fragrance clings to the hand that gives flowers.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Adaptability is not imitation. It means the power of resistance and assimilation.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The art of life lies in a constant readjustment to our surroundings.
author: Kakuzo Okakura

text: To drop into being means to recognize your interconnectedness with all life, and with being itself.
author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

text: Say not, 'I have found the truth,' but rather, 'I have found a truth.'
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: Judge a man by his questions rather than by his answers.
author: Voltaire

text: Dance to the beat of your heart - step to the rhythm of your pulse - move to the music of your soul.
author: Unknown

text: Patterns cannot be weighed or measured. Patterns must be mapped.
author: Fritjof Capra

text: What we call chaos is just patterns we haven't recognized. What we call random is just patterns we can't decipher.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

text: Equipped with his five senses, man explores the universe around him and calls the adventure Science.
author: Edwin Powell Hubble

text: No aquarium, no tank in a marine land, however spacious it may be, can begin to duplicate the conditions of the sea.
author: Jacques Cousteau

text: In music, silence is more important than sound.
author: Miles Davis

text: This world spins from the same unseen forces that twist our hearts.
author: David Mitchell

text: Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: The key to growth is the introduction of higher dimensions of consciousness into our awareness.
author: Lao Tzu

text: One does not become enlightened by imagining figures of light, but by making the darkness conscious.
author: C.G. Jung

text: Each lifetime is a chapter in the unending book of your soul.
author: Unknown

text: When you actively notice new things, that puts you in the present.
author: Ellen J. Langer

text: The smallest deed is better than the greatest intention.
author: John Burroughs

text: Courage isn't the roar; it's the small voice that says, 'I'll try again tomorrow.'
author: Mary Anne Radmacher

text: Nothing in known physics corresponds to the passage of time.
author: Paul Davies

text: The great ecosystems are like complex tapestries - a million complicated threads, interwoven, make up the whole picture.
author: Unknown

text: The true meaning of life is to plant trees, under whose shade you do not expect to sit.
author: Nelson Henderson

text: Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Stories can shape our perception of the world around us.
author: Unknown

text: Strength is in vulnerability.
author: Brené Brown

text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: Not all those who wander are lost.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
author: Aristotle

text: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
author: Edmund Burke

text: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
author: Robert Frost

text: The person who reads too much and uses his brain too little will fall into lazy habits of thinking.
author: Albert Einstein

text: You can never cross the ocean until you have the courage to lose sight of the shore.
author: Christopher Columbus

text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.
author: Plutarch

text: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
author: Helen Keller

text: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: I have decided to stick with love. Hate is too great a burden to bear.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: It always seems impossible until it's done.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The only way to deal with an unfree world is to become so absolutely free that your very existence is an act of rebellion.
author: Albert Camus

text: We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are.
author: Anaïs Nin

text: The privilege of a lifetime is to become who you truly are.
author: Carl Jung

text: When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us.
author: Helen Keller

text: The first principle is that you must not fool yourself—and you are the easiest person to fool.
author: Richard Feynman

text: The wound is the place where the Light enters you.
author: Rumi

text: You have power over your mind—not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The price of anything is the amount of life you exchange for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.
author: Alice Walker

text: If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.
author: African Proverb

text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: You can cut all the flowers but you cannot keep spring from coming.
author: Pablo Neruda

text: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud.
author: Coco Chanel

text: The only real mistake is the one from which we learn nothing.
author: Henry Ford

text: A ship is always safe at shore but that is not what it's built for.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page.
author: Saint Augustine

text: The purpose of art is washing the dust of daily life off our souls.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: You can never be overdressed or overeducated.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another.
author: William James

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: Never let your sense of morals prevent you from doing what is right.
author: Isaac Asimov

text: A room without books is like a body without a soul.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

text: The expert in anything was once a beginner.
author: Helen Hayes

text: The only thing worse than being blind is having sight but no vision.
author: Helen Keller

text: If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything.
author: Malcolm X

text: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
author: Plato

text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: The best preparation for tomorrow is doing your best today.
author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

text: Never interrupt someone doing what you said couldn't be done.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: A wise man can learn more from a foolish question than a fool can learn from a wise answer.
author: Bruce Lee

text: The creation of a thousand forests is in one acorn.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: The most wasted of days is one without laughter.
author: e.e. cummings

text: The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well.
author: Alfred Adler

text: The world is changed by your example, not by your opinion.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: The greatest danger for most of us is not that our aim is too high and we miss it, but that it is too low and we reach it.
author: Michelangelo

text: The mind is not a vessel to be filled but a fire to be kindled.
author: Plutarch

text: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, some are strong at the broken places.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: The only thing standing between you and your goal is the story you keep telling yourself as to why you can't achieve it.
author: Jordan Belfort

text: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.
author: Mark Twain

text: The best way out is always through.
author: Robert Frost

text: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
author: Confucius

text: The more you know yourself, the more patience you have for what you see in others.
author: Erik Erikson

text: The greatest discovery of any generation is that a human can alter his life by altering his attitude.
author: William James

text: The most important kind of freedom is to be what you really are.
author: Jim Morrison

text: The only real valuable thing is intuition.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The world is full of magical things patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper.
author: Bertrand Russell

text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The greatest gift you can give someone is your time because when you give your time, you are giving a portion of your life that you will never get back.
author: Anonymous

text: The secret of change is to focus all of your energy not on fighting the old, but on building the new.
author: Socrates

text: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.
author: Helen Keller

text: Stay afraid, but do it anyway. What's important is the action. You don't have to wait to be confident. Just do it and eventually the confidence will follow.
author: Carrie Fisher

text: One can choose to go back toward safety or forward toward growth. Growth must be chosen again and again; fear must be overcome again and again.
author: Abraham Maslow

text: We can't become what we need to be by remaining what we are.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: If there is no struggle, there is no progress.
author: Frederick Douglass

text: Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending.
author: Carl Bard

text: Change brings opportunity.
author: Nido Qubein

text: People who are crazy enough to think they can change the world are the ones who do.
author: Rob Siltanen

text: Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover.
author: Mark Twain

text: You are the one that possesses the keys to your being. You carry the passport to your own happiness.
author: Diane von Furstenberg

text: The way I see it, if you want the rainbow, you gotta put up with the rain.
author: Dolly Parton

text: You'll seldom experience regret for anything that you've done. It is what you haven't done that will torment you.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: The only time you run out of chances is when you stop taking them.
author: Unknown

text: The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.
author: William A. Ward

text: The bad news is time flies. The good news is you're the pilot.
author: Michael Altshuler

text: If what you have done yesterday still looks big to you, you haven't done much today.
author: Mikhail Gorbachev

text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go.
author: Carol Burnett

text: You do not find the happy life. You make it.
author: Camilla Eyring Kimball

text: If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else.
author: Booker T. Washington

text: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.
author: Thomas Edison

text: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
author: Alan Watts

text: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: The measure of intelligence is the ability to change.
author: Albert Einstein

text: We must let go of the life we have planned, so as to accept the one that is waiting for us.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: The flower that blooms in adversity is the most rare and beautiful of all.
author: Walt Disney Company

text: It is not the mountain we conquer, but ourselves.
author: Sir Edmund Hillary

text: Life is a progress, and not a station.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: May your choices reflect your hopes, not your fears.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The root of joy is gratefulness.
author: David Steindl-Rast

text: To improve is to change; to be perfect is to change often.
author: Winston Churchill

text: We do not see things as they are, we see them as we are.
author: Anaïs Nin

text: He who is not courageous enough to take risks will accomplish nothing in life.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: The only journey is the one within.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

text: If you fell down yesterday, stand up today.
author: H.G. Wells

text: What is now proved was once only imagined.
author: William Blake

text: The desire to reach for the stars is ambitious. The desire to reach hearts is wise.
author: Maya Angelou

text: A ship in harbor is safe, but that is not what ships are built for.
author: John A. Shedd

text: Open your eyes, look within. Are you satisfied with the life you're living?
author: Bob Marley

text: The best way to capture moments is to pay attention. This is how we cultivate mindfulness.
author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

text: Doubt kills more dreams than failure ever will.
author: Suzy Kassem

text: The difference between a successful person and others is not a lack of strength, not a lack of knowledge, but rather a lack in will.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become.
author: Carl Jung

text: To acquire knowledge, one must study; but to acquire wisdom, one must observe.
author: Marilyn vos Savant

text: Creativity is intelligence having fun.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The greater the obstacle, the more glory in overcoming it.
author: Molière

text: A man is but what he knows.
author: Francis Bacon

text: The art of being wise is the art of knowing what to overlook.
author: William James

text: Vulnerability is the birthplace of innovation, creativity and change.
author: Brené Brown

text: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

text: Persistence is to the character of man as carbon is to steel.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
author: Jimi Hendrix

text: Innovation is taking two things that exist and putting them together in a new way.
author: Tom Freston

text: We learn from failure, not from success!
author: Bram Stoker

text: The world is a tragedy to those who feel, but a comedy to those who think.
author: Horace Walpole

text: Fall seven times and stand up eight.
author: Japanese Proverb

text: The beautiful thing about learning is that no one can take it away from you.
author: B.B. King

text: If you want something new, you have to stop doing something old.
author: Peter Drucker

text: Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Smooth seas do not make skillful sailors.
author: African Proverb

text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Will Durant

text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: An unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

text: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
author: Aristotle

text: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.
author: Plato

text: The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.
author: Aristotle

text: Silence is a source of great strength.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom. Mastering others is strength; mastering yourself is true power.
author: Lao Tzu

text: He who knows that enough is enough will always have enough.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Muddy water is best cleared by leaving it alone.
author: Alan Watts

text: Trying to manage things, trying to force things to conform to your will only makes for more frustration.
author: Alan Watts

text: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: You have power over your mind – not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
author: Seneca

text: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
author: Seneca

text: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
author: Seneca

text: Man is not worried by real problems so much as by his imagined anxieties about real problems.
author: Epictetus

text: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
author: Epictetus

text: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
author: Epictetus

text: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
author: Epictetus

text: The world is a comedy to those that think, a tragedy to those that feel.
author: Horace Walpole

text: To live is so startling it leaves little time for anything else.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: Forever is composed of nows.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: That it will never come again is what makes life so sweet.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: The only way out of the labyrinth of suffering is to forgive.
author: John Green

text: What is the point of being alive if you don't at least try to do something remarkable?
author: John Green

text: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

text: And now that you don't have to be perfect, you can be good.
author: John Steinbeck

text: Happiness can be found even in the darkest of times if only someone remembers to turn on the light.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: You are your best thing.
author: Toni Morrison

text: Even the darkest night will end and the sun will rise.
author: Victor Hugo

text: In spite of everything I still believe that people are really good at heart.
author: Anne Frank

text: You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: Nothing in the world is ever completely wrong. Even a stopped clock is right twice a day.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: No need to hurry. No need to sparkle. No need to be anybody but oneself.
author: Virginia Woolf

text: Just think happy thoughts and you'll fly.
author: J.M. Barrie

text: I would rather be happy than dignified.
author: Charlotte Brontë

text: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

text: With freedom, books, flowers and the moon, who could not be happy?
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Things we lose have a way of coming back to us in the end, if not always in the way we expect.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try again. Fail again. Fail better.
author: Samuel Beckett

text: Live all you can; it's a mistake not to.
author: Henry James

text: You will become way less concerned with what other people think of you when you realize how seldom they do.
author: David Foster Wallace

text: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given to us.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: The only thing worse than being talked about is not being talked about.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: When you take risks, you learn that there will be times when you succeed, and there will be times when you fail, and both are equally important.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

text: Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The future belongs to those who prepare for it today.
author: Malcolm X

text: What lies behind you and what lies in front of you, pales in comparison to what lies inside of you.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
author: Buddha

text: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life.
author: Steve Jobs

text: The only source of knowledge is experience.
author: Albert Einstein

text: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

text: You must do the things you think you cannot do.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: The best revenge is massive success.
author: Frank Sinatra

text: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
author: Jimmy Dean

text: If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else.
author: Booker T. Washington

text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: An unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

text: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

text: Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Get busy living or get busy dying.
author: Stephen King

text: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.
author: Mae West

text: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
author: Mark Twain

text: A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Do one thing every day that scares you.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: It is not the strongest of the species that survive, nor the most intelligent, but the one most responsive to change.
author: Charles Darwin

text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Keep your face always toward the sunshine, and shadows will fall behind you.
author: Walt Whitman

text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: The mind is a wonderful servant, but a terrible master.
author: Robin Sharma

text: What we think, we become.
author: Buddha

text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves.
author: William Shakespeare

text: The harder the conflict, the more glorious the triumph.
author: Thomas Paine

text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Aristotle

text: The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.
author: Aristotle

text: Life itself is the most wonderful fairy tale.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: If you are working on something that you really care about, you don't have to be pushed. The vision pulls you.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

text: The only person you should try to be better than is the person you were yesterday.
author: Anonymous

text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson

text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: The future depends on what you do today.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Well done is better than well said.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: You can't use up creativity. The more you use, the more you have.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Dream big and dare to fail.
author: Norman Vaughan

text: Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
author: George Addair

text: Fall seven times, stand up eight.
author: Japanese Proverb

text: The mind is like a parachute. It doesn't work if it is not open.
author: Frank Zappa

text: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you've imagined.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: The only way to achieve the impossible is to believe it is possible.
author: Charles Kingsleigh (Alice in Wonderland)

text: Life is 10% what happens to us and 90% how we react to it.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

text: If you want to be happy, be.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: The universe is made of stories, not of atoms.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

text: Between stimulus and response there is a space. In that space is our power to choose our response. In our response lies our growth and our freedom.
author: Viktor E. Frankl

text: The most common form of despair is not being who you are.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

text: We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: The privilege of a lifetime is being who you are.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: A comfort zone is a beautiful place, but nothing ever grows there.
author: Unknown

text: You can discover more about a person in an hour of play than in a year of conversation.
author: Plato

text: The snake which cannot cast its skin has to die. As well the minds which are prevented from changing their opinions; they cease to be mind.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: And those who were seen dancing were thought to be insane by those who could not hear the music.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: I am not what happened to me. I am what I choose to become.
author: Carl Jung

text: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

text: The goal isn't to live forever, the goal is to create something that will.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

text: Everything can be taken from a man but one thing: the last of the human freedoms—to choose one's attitude in any given set of circumstances.
author: Viktor E. Frankl

text: The curious paradox is that when I accept myself just as I am, then I can change.
author: Carl Rogers

text: The truth will set you free, but first it will piss you off.
author: Gloria Steinem

text: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Nobody cares how much you know, until they know how much you care.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.
author: Steve Maraboli

text: Your assumptions are your windows on the world. Scrub them off every once in a while, or the light won't come in.
author: Isaac Asimov

text: The most beautiful experience we can have is the mysterious. It is the fundamental emotion that stands at the cradle of true art and true science.
author: Albert Einstein

text: We are not human beings having a spiritual experience. We are spiritual beings having a human experience.
author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

text: The trouble is not in dying for a friend, but in finding a friend worth dying for.
author: Mark Twain

text: You will face your greatest opposition when you are closest to your biggest miracle.
author: Shannon L. Alder

text: The ultimate measure of a person is not where they stand in moments of comfort and convenience, but where they stand in times of challenge and controversy.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: You can easily judge the character of a person by how they treat those who can do nothing for them.
author: Malcolm S. Forbes

text: Ego says, 'Once everything falls into place, I'll feel peace.' Spirit says, 'Find your peace, and then everything will fall into place.'
author: Marianne Williamson

text: The most important thing in life is to learn how to give out love, and to let it come in.
author: Morrie Schwartz

text: Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it.
author: Rumi

text: The cost of not following your heart is spending the rest of your life wishing you had.
author: J. Paulsen

text: How we spend our days is, of course, how we spend our lives.
author: Annie Dillard

text: Be a lamp, or a lifeboat, or a ladder. Help someone's soul heal. Walk out of your house like a shepherd.
author: Rumi

text: You must give everything to make your life as beautiful as the dreams that dance in your imagination.
author: Roman Payne

text: The oak fought the wind and was broken, the willow bent when it must and survived.
author: Robert Jordan

text: An eye for an eye will only make the whole world blind.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity.
author: Dorothy Parker

text: The beginning of freedom is the realization that you are not 'the thinker.' The moment you start watching the thinker, a higher level of consciousness becomes activated.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: When another person makes you suffer, it is because he suffers deeply within himself, and his suffering is spilling over.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

text: What you seek is seeking you.
author: Rumi

text: The world will be saved by beauty.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

text: We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are.
author: Anaïs Nin

text: The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate, to have it make some difference that you have lived and lived well.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Do not be satisfied with the stories that come before you. Unfold your own myth.
author: Rumi

text: The nitrogen in our DNA, the calcium in our teeth, the iron in our blood, the carbon in our apple pies were made in the interiors of collapsing stars. We are made of starstuff.
author: Carl Sagan

text: What matters most is how well you walk through the fire.
author: Charles Bukowski

text: Out beyond ideas of wrongdoing and rightdoing there is a field. I'll meet you there.
author: Rumi

text: Treat people as if they were what they ought to be, and you help them become what they are capable of being.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Life is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats.
author: Voltaire

text: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.
author: Marcel Proust

text: I would rather die of passion than of boredom.
author: Vincent van Gogh

text: The true delight is in the finding out rather than in the knowing.
author: Isaac Asimov

text: Listen with curiosity. Speak with honesty. Act with integrity.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Maybe the journey isn't so much about becoming anything. Maybe it's about un-becoming everything that isn't really you.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Don't grieve. Anything you lose comes round in another form.
author: Rumi

text: Stand at the crossroads and look; ask for the ancient paths, ask where the good way is, and walk in it, and you will find rest for your souls.
author: Jeremiah 6:16

text: The moment one gives close attention to anything, even a blade of grass, it becomes a mysterious, awesome, indescribably magnificent world in itself.
author: Henry Miller

text: The day the child realizes that all adults are imperfect, he becomes an adolescent; the day he forgives them, he becomes an adult; the day he forgives himself, he becomes wise.
author: Alden Nowlan

text: If you are irritated by every rub, how will your mirror be polished?
author: Rumi

text: The primary cause of unhappiness is never the situation but your thoughts about it.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: There are years that ask questions and years that answer.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

text: A mind that is stretched by a new experience can never go back to its old dimensions.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

text: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.
author: Dale Carnegie

text: Fear defeats more people than any other one thing in the world.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Do not go gentle into that good night. Rage, rage against the dying of the light.
author: Dylan Thomas

text: The secret to getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.
author: Mae West

text: Sometimes the questions are complicated and the answers are simple.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
author: Winston Churchill

text: The only way to learn mathematics is to do mathematics.
author: Paul Halmos

text: Normality is a paved road: It's comfortable to walk, but no flowers grow on it.
author: Vincent van Gogh

text: A smooth sea never made a skilled sailor.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: The pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity. The optimist sees opportunity in every difficulty.
author: Winston Churchill

text: He who opens a school door, closes a prison.
author: Victor Hugo

text: Creativity takes courage.
author: Henri Matisse

text: Don't count the days, make the days count.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Wisdom begins in wonder.
author: Socrates

text: A room without books is like a body without a soul.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

text: What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make.
author: Jane Goodall

text: Those who don't believe in magic will never find it.
author: Roald Dahl

text: Every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: All limitations are self-imposed.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

text: If you hear a voice within you say you cannot paint, then by all means paint and that voice will be silenced.
author: Vincent van Gogh

text: The best dreams happen when you're awake.
author: Cherie Gilderbloom

text: Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that.
author: Mark Twain

text: If you think education is expensive, try ignorance.
author: Derek Bok

text: It takes as much energy to wish as it does to plan.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: The worst enemy to creativity is self-doubt.
author: Sylvia Plath

text: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Don't limit your challenges. Challenge your limits.
author: Jerry Dunn

text: Action is the foundational key to all success.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success.
author: Albert Schweitzer

text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
author: Buddha

text: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: A journey is best measured in friends, not in miles.
author: Tim Cahill

text: Success isn't about how much money you make, it's about the difference you make in people's lives.
author: Michelle Obama

text: You don't have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Success is doing ordinary things extraordinarily well.
author: Jim Rohn

text: You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.
author: William Faulkner

text: Start by doing what's necessary; then do what's possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
author: Francis of Assisi

text: One day, in retrospect, the years of struggle will strike you as the most beautiful.
author: Sigmund Freud

text: Don't wait. The time will never be just right.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: The man who has no imagination has no wings.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Work like there is someone working 24 hours a day to take it away from you.
author: Mark Cuban

text: If you want something you've never had, you must be willing to do something you've never done.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: A wise man can learn more from a foolish question than a fool can learn from a wise answer.
author: Bruce Lee

text: Sometimes the smallest step in the right direction ends up being the biggest step of your life.
author: Naeem Callaway

text: Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: You can't use up creativity. The more you use, the more you have.
author: Maya Angelou

text: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door.
author: Milton Berle

text: Life begins at the end of your comfort zone.
author: Neale Donald Walsch

text: Don't raise your voice, improve your argument.
author: Desmond Tutu

text: The sky is not the limit. Your mind is.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: Every artist was first an amateur.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Fall in love with the process and the results will come.
author: Eric Thomas

text: You don't rise to the level of your goals, you fall to the level of your systems.
author: James Clear

text: You can’t go back and change the beginning, but you can start where you are and change the ending.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: It’s not the load that breaks you down, it’s the way you carry it.
author: Lou Holtz

text: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.
author: Jim Rohn

text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: Les Brown

text: Success is often the result of taking a misstep in the right direction.
author: Al Bernstein

text: Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree.
author: Martin Luther

text: Dreams don’t work unless you do.
author: John C. Maxwell

text: Hustle beats talent when talent doesn’t hustle.
author: Ross Simmonds

text: You are what you do, not what you say you’ll do.
author: Carl Jung

text: Don’t tell people your plans. Show them your results.
author: Unknown

text: You cannot escape the responsibility of tomorrow by evading it today.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Clarity precedes success.
author: Robin Sharma

text: Stop being afraid of what could go wrong and start being excited about what could go right.
author: Tony Robbins

text: It always seems too soon until it’s too late.
author: Unknown

text: Life is not about finding yourself. It’s about creating yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Don’t wish it were easier. Wish you were better.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out.
author: Robert Collier

text: The mind is like water. When it’s turbulent, it’s difficult to see. When it’s calm, everything becomes clear.
author: Prasad Mahes

text: If you don’t like something, change it. If you can’t change it, change your attitude.
author: Maya Angelou

text: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think.
author: Buddha

text: Let your hopes, not your hurts, shape your future.
author: Robert H. Schuller

text: Be so good they can’t ignore you.
author: Steve Martin

text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: What consumes your mind controls your life.
author: Unknown

text: You’ll never change your life until you change something you do daily.
author: John C. Maxwell

text: Keep going. Everything you need will come to you at the perfect time.
author: Unknown

text: Be brave enough to be bad at something new.
author: Jon Acuff

text: The expert in anything was once a beginner.
author: Helen Hayes

text: If you change nothing, nothing will change.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Energy flows where attention goes.
author: Tony Robbins
